alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Halifax; Warren (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued May 23 at 4:58PM EDT until May 23 at 5:45PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Raleigh has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Southern Warren County in central North Carolina... Northwestern Halifax County in central North Carolina... Northeastern Franklin County in central North Carolina... * Until 545 PM EDT. * At 458 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 7 miles north of Louisburg, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This dangerous storm will be near... Littleton around 535 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Arcola, Ingleside, Medoc Mountain State Park, Airlie and Afton. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
